results.title: Angler's island
results.brief_description: Trout fishing in Tasmania. Trout were released into Tasmanian streams a century ago, and anglers fish in many places with historical associations. Trout are caught, stripped and the young raised in hatcheries to re-stock streams. Shannon Rise during the caddis moth season and the lonely lakes in western Tasmania are favourite haunts for anglers.

results.title: Angle Bay
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum, Aselwood Productions and Ralph Keene
results.brief_description: Angle Bay lies on the southern shore of Milford Haven in Pembrokshire. A scenic and historical impression of this ancient land is given, and the film then reverts to the present day, for Angle Bay is now an ocean terminal and Milford Haven a deep-water harbour for oil tankers. Narrated by Anthony Quayle.

results.title: Angiosperms: the flowering plants
results.brief_description: The flowering plants called angiosperms, the dominant form of terrestrial plant life, are adapted to great extremes of temperature and moisture and range geographically from the arctic zones to the tropics. Shows the structural and reproductive characteristics which distinguish them from other plants. Traces the processes of pollination, formation of seeds and fruit, seed dispersal, and plant growth.

results.title: Angi Vera
results.creator_credit: Mafilm, Objektiv Filmstudio Vallalat and Pal Gabor
results.brief_description: Stalinist Hungary, 1948. A young nurse, honest enough to criticise the conditions in the hospital where she works, is singled out by the party for political training. Gabor’s understated drama follows her transformation from a relatively naive eighteen year-old into a cool political operator, her integrity traded for a position in the Party. The film objectively critiques the years of oppressive Stalinist dogma in Hungary, leaving the viewer to draw his or her own conclusion. Based on the novel by Endre Veszi. Cast includes Veronika Pap, Erzsi Pasztor, Eva Szabo and Tamas Dunai. In Hungarian with English subtitles.

results.title: Anger at work
results.creator_credit: Oaklahoma. State Dept. of Health, International Film Bureau and Ned Huckman
results.brief_description: Explains the mechanisms of man’s personality which induces displacement of anger onto other men and impairs efficiency in everyday living. Dramatizes techniques that have been developed for handling anger, resentment and frustration

results.title: Angels with dirty faces
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: Despite his success in musicals and comedies throughout his career, James Cagney will be remembered best for his tough guys roles in “White heat”, “Public enemy” and “Angels with dirty faces”. Boyhood friends Rocky (Cagney) and Jerry (Pat O’Brien) grew up in opposite directions; one a hoodlum, the other a priest overseeing a group of orphans in the neighbourhood where he and Rocky grew up. These youngsters idolise Rocky and soon they’re breaking the law in an effort to win his respect. Fearing for the boys’ future, Father Connelly takes a stand against Rocky’s underworld ways, leading to one of the classic James Cagney shoot outs. The ending of this picture transcends its gangster-film surface and elevates it to that of meaningful social commentary, wherein Rocky has to face the true meaning of courage. The case also includes a young Humphrey Bogart as Rocky’s two-faced lawyer.

results.title: Angels over Broadway
results.creator_credit: Ben Hecht, Columbia Pictures and Lee Garmes
results.brief_description: Angels over Broadway is a stylish looking black and white crime drama which takes place on one rainy night in New York. In a nightclub on Broadway called the Pigeon Club a suicidal embezzler arrives, wet and hopeless. He is mistaken as a rich country hick ripe for hustling. An alcoholic playwright becomes involved and the plot unfolds. This film, written and directed by Ben Hecht who is famous for witty and sharp dialogue, is well acted with an impressive cast. The hustler and would-be gangster, Douglas Fairbanks Jr. is teamed with the good-time girl Rita Hayworth. With a fine script of ironic and poetic dialogue this dark drama is compelling. The noir themes of espionage, gambling, suicide and bad guys turning good are present in this shadowy, cynical and articulate film. With an Academy Award nomination for Best Original Screenplay this is a fine film located in the world of loners, hustlers and has-beens. Cast includes Thomas Mitchell and John Qualen.

results.title: Angels of war
results.creator_credit: Andrew Pike, Australian National University. Research School of Pacific Studies, Hank Nelson and Gavan Daws
results.brief_description: Papua New Guinea men recount their experiences when war came to their islands in 1942. During three years a million Americans, 300,000 Japanese and nearly half a million Australians fought their way across the country. Cut into their memories are archival film sequences shot by Japanese, American and Australian cameramen and the songs and poems of black men and white writing about life and death in time of war. Now the men speak passionately of the white man’s promises, made to them in war and never kept in peace.
